posts.post_content: Useful for a sort of mana accel (since two of your lands can be used twice) and for dropping Beasts down. If you play him in a deck with lots of Overrun or a Titanic Ultimatum, you don't even need to bother using his last ability.

Posted By: Grimn777 (8/3/2009 9:41:37 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
this is probably, objectively, the best planeswalker. (though my heart is always with sarkhan) not flashy like the others but with 3 very useful, efficiently costed, and consistent abilities. reusing 2 lands a turn is probably one of the best manna excel effects ever, and on a 4 cmc body it's very cheap if you can reuse it. his second ability is, at very worst (VERY WORST) a [hill giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hill giant), and his last is [overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=overrun), one of the most common green win conditions.   
and with the final one turn away it can most likely be used whenever you need.  
It is cheap, useful, efficient, and multipurpose. Can find a place in all green decks, and most decks which use green.  
not game breaking but consistent.
posts.html:

and with the final one turn away it can most likely be used whenever you need.
It is cheap, useful, efficient, and multipurpose. Can find a place in all green decks, and most decks which use green.
not game breaking but consistent.

posts.post_content:
A very solid and extremely quick planeswalker, befitting his color. He acts as two free mana per turn in the beginning, and his ultimate is an [Overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overrun). Even with 4 or 5 creatures, his ultimate can entirely decimate an opponent.  
  
Also, I got him in my first M10 booster pack. That was a nice surprise.
posts.html:
A very solid and extremely quick planeswalker, befitting his color. He acts as two free mana per turn in the beginning, and his ultimate is an Overrun. Even with 4 or 5 creatures, his ultimate can entirely decimate an opponent.

Also, I got him in my first M10 booster pack. That was a nice surprise.

posts.post_content:
I like garruk (He was my first planeswlaker) but I don't really like the flavor.. his abilities are pretty broken, but shouldn't he do something BIGGER? I mean, he's the embodiement of green, and maybe he should have had an ability like ajani's...
  
   
BIG, BAD, CREATURE W/P/T=your life!
  
   
Instead, they opted for a green ability, but not a VERY green one.
  
   
That said, he's my third favorite planeswalker, first Jace, and then the other Jace.

posts.post_content:
Faust-The-Desolate  
  
you don't have priority. you can't lightning bolt until you do. Garruk can use his +1 ability to untap 2 lands and gain the 1 loyalty counter as part of using the ability, in response you may lightning bolt. If they make the 3/3 beast then in response you could lightning bolt and destroy him but they would still get the beast.

posts.post_content: All planeswalkers combo with [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season), but Garruk combos best. He's green, his second ability creates token creatures, and his ultimate is made for token decks. And if you have the Season out when Garruk comes into play, he can ultimate immediately.
